page.title: 11Kimblesworth-Cricket
page.content:
{Cricket}
Village cricket has long been a part of our country's tradition and Kimblesworth is no exception. A cricket team was formed in 1879 and was known as The Kimblesworth Miners Welfare Cricket Club. This team was one of the founder members of the North-West Durham Cricket League. There were 11 other village teams in this league and all were connected and supported by the collieries of the area. The Kimblesworth club have had several successful years - being League Cup winners in 1936, 1937, 1938, 1951 and 1958. During the 106 years this club has been in existence it has had only 6 professional players, relying on members born and living in the village.
